intro: Galium mildbraedii, commonly known as the mildbraed’s bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of native plant communities and a subject of ecological study.
